start.text: Begone from me, stardimmer. Your own hand has vaporized your purpose.

You thrived at the performance of a pruning motion, utensil. Now store yourself until Fate reshapes you.
The end.

start.IfNotFinishedQuestStep: If, Then, Else~Reunite Tau with Her Chime
start.text: The utensil arrives. You, to prune the fate-rhizome and free our girl. Go now and perform the motion.
start.choice: You're a seeker of the Sightless Way?

start.text: Give her your parting words, utensil. Our hearts are in elsewhere.
Begone. Fate has not yet shaped you, utensil.

node.text: Utensil? That is my avocation, yes. A million sun-dead homes I've roved, a trillion more await. I'm a worm in the loam of a cosmic wood, perched on a cosmic gulf, swathed in the god-manifold.

Prune! The utensil prunes! -but no, the utensil quivers in uncertainty and vibrates out a question?
The self is riddled with category errors. The thinking brain mistakes formation for meaning.
node.choice: Tell me. I wish to understand.

node.text: Maggot! What do you think words are? Arrows of inquiry? Words are bricks. Each spoken is laid in bond and builds your prison. There is no understanding.
You tarry on the future's boundary with abandon, utensil. Throw your brick if you dare.
